hints.title: Bounded Velocity Variance Expansion from Cloning
hints.content:
6797: :label: thm-velocity-variance-bounded-expansion
6798: 
6799: There exists a state-independent constant $C_v < \infty$ such that for any swarm $S$:
6800: 
6801: $$
6802: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{Var},v}(S')] \leq V_{\text{Var},v}(S) + C_v
6803: $$
6804:

6806: 
6807: $$
6808: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq C_v

6797: :label: thm-velocity-variance-bounded-expansion
6798: 
6799: There exists a state-independent constant $C_v < \infty$ such that for any swarm $S$:
6800: 
6801: $$
6802: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{Var},v}(S')] \leq V_{\text{Var},v}(S) + C_v
6803: $$
6804:

6806:

6808: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq C_v

hints.label: proof-thm-velocity-variance-bounded-expansion
hints.content:
6815: :::{prf:proof}
6816: :label: proof-thm-velocity-variance-bounded-expansion
6817: **Proof.**
6818: 
6819: The proof analyzes how the inelastic collision model affects velocity variance.
6820: 
6821: **Step 1: Velocity domain boundedness**
6822: 
6823: By Axiom EG-4 (velocity regularization), all walker velocities in viable swarms satisfy:
6824: 
6825: $$
6826: \|v_i\| \leq V_{\max} := \sqrt{\max\left\{\frac{2F_{\max}}{\gamma}, V_{\text{thresh}}^2\right\}}
6827: $$
6828: 
6829: This bound is state-independent, depending only on physical parameters.
6830: 
6831: **Step 2: Per-walker velocity change**
6832: 
6833: When walker $i$ participates in an $(M+1)$-particle inelastic collision, its velocity changes from $v_i$ to:
6834: 
6835: $$
6836: v'_i = V_{\text{COM}} + \alpha_{\text{restitution}} \cdot R_i(u_i)
6837: $$
6838: 
6839: where $u_i = v_i - V_{\text{COM}}$ and $R_i$ is a random rotation.
6840: 
6841: The squared velocity change is bounded:
6842: 
6843: $$
6844: \|v'_i - v_i\|^2 = \|\alpha_{\text{restitution}} \cdot R_i(u_i) - u_i\|^2 \leq (\alpha_{\text{restitution}} + 1)^2 \|u_i\|^2
6845: $$
6846: 
6847: Since $\|u_i\| \leq 2V_{\max}$ (difference of two bounded velocities):
6848: 
6849: $$
6850: \|v'_i - v_i\|^2 \leq 4(\alpha_{\text{restitution}} + 1)^2 V_{\max}^2
6851: $$
6852: 
6853: **Step 3: Variance change decomposition**
6854: 
6855: The velocity variance changes due to:
6856: 
6857: 1. **Direct velocity resets** for cloned walkers (bounded by Step 2)
6858: 2. **Barycenter shift** affecting centered velocities (bounded by total momentum conservation)
6859: 3. **Random rotations** redistributing kinetic energy (bounded by elastic limit)
6860: 
6861: Each contribution is bounded by constants depending only on $V_{\max}$, $\alpha_{\text{restitution}}$, and $N$.
6862: 
6863: **Step 4: Total bounded expansion**
6864: 
6865: Summing over all walkers and using $N$-normalization:
6866: 
6867: $$
6868: \mathbb{E}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N p_i \cdot 4(\alpha_{\text{restitution}} + 1)^2 V_{\max}^2 + C_{\text{bary}}
6869: $$
6870: 
6871: Since $p_i \in [0,1]$ and $\sum_i p_i \leq N$ (at most all walkers clone):
6872: 
6873: $$
6874: \mathbb{E}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq 4(\alpha_{\text{restitution}} + 1)^2 V_{\max}^2 + C_{\text{bary}} =: C_v
6875: $$
6876: 
6877: This constant is **state-independent** and **$N$-independent** (the $N$ cancels in the normalization).

hints.label: rem-synergistic-velocity-dissipation
hints.title: Synergistic Dissipation Enables Net Contraction
hints.content:
6883: :label: rem-synergistic-velocity-dissipation
6884: 
6885: This bounded expansion is the prerequisite for the synergistic dissipation framework. The companion document will prove that the kinetic operator provides velocity contraction:
6886: 
6887: $$
6888: \mathbb{E}_{\text{kin}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq -\kappa_v V_{\text{Var},v} + C'_v
6889: $$
6890: 
6891: for some $\kappa_v > 0$ proportional to the Langevin friction $\gamma$.
6892: 
6893: When properly balanced:
6894: 
6895: $$
6896: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone} \circ \text{kin}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq -\kappa_v V_{\text{Var},v} + (C_v + C'_v)
6897: $$
